#Text=Polycrystalline Pr‚ÄìCo‚ÄìSi and La‚ÄìCo‚ÄìSi (as non-magnetic reference) samples were prepared using conventional arc-melting procedure, taking the pure (‚â•99.9%) constituent elements in the proper ratio.
#Text=The ingots were remelted 6 times by flipping them after every melt to promote homogeneity.
#Text=The weight loss during the melting procedure was estimated to be very small (‚â§0.5%).
#Text=The samples were then sealed in an evacuated quartz tube and annealed for 10 days at 1000‚àòC, thereafter cooled to room temperature at a rate of 100‚àòC/hr.
#Text=Powder x-ray diffraction (XRD) measurements at room temperature and lower temperatures have been performed using 9 kW CuKùõº radiation on a TTRAX-III diffractometer (M/S.
#Text=Rigaku Corp., Japan).

#Text=Room temperature measurement has been carried out with solid state detector while the measurements to investigate the possible structural changes with variation in temperature, has been performed in a low temperature setup having gas detector.
#Text=Zero-field neutron diffraction experiments were performed at different temperatures in the ECHIDNA beamline92 in ANSTO, Australia.
#Text=FullProf programme package93 was used to analyze the XRD and ND data for structural characterization.
#Text=Elemental composition and phase homogeneity have been checked through scanning electron microscope (SEM) measurements in the instrument EVO 18 (M/S.
#Text=Carl Zeiss, AG, Germany) and energy dispersive analysis of X-ray (EDX) measurements were performed in a commercial Element EDS system (M/S.
#Text=EDAX, USA).
#Text=DC magnetizations in the temperature range 2‚Äì300 K were measured for different magnetic fields (‚àí 70 kOe ‚â§ magnetic field (H) ‚â§70kOe) using an Evercool II VSM (M/s.
#Text=Quantum Design Inc., USA) and SQUID VSM (M/s.
#Text=Quantum Design Inc., USA).
#Text=The dc magnetization data are taken both in zero-field-cooled (ZFC) and field-cooled (FC) protocols.

#Text=In ZFC protocol, the sample is first cooled from the high temperature (essentially room temperature) to the lowest achievable temperature (2 K) in the absence of any external magnetic field, following which a magnetic field of desired strength is applied and magnetic moment is measured as a function of temperature.

#Text=In contrast, in the field-cooled (FC) protocol, the system is cooled in the presence of magnetic field and the magnetization is measured in heating cycle Ôªøi.e. field-cooled-warming (FCW, hence after called as FC).
#Text=The measurements for ùëÄ‚àíùêª isotherms were carried out in the ZFC mode and the system was taken to paramagnetic region before starting each measurement.
#Text=Zero-field heat capacity measurement was carried out in the temperature range 2‚Äì300 K, using a commercial Physical Property Measurement System (PPMS) (M/s.
#Text=Quantum Design Inc., USA). ùúáSR measurements were carried out using EMU spectrometer at the ISIS facility, Rutherford Appleton Laboratory, UK.
#Text=Details of the ùúáSR measurements have been presented in the related section of this manuscript and supplementary material.
